active_learning.discussion_prompt: Evaluate the trade-offs of implementing Perfect Forward Secrecy (PFS) in resource-constrained IoT devices versus enterprise servers. Debate using real-world examples from RFC 9325 recommendations and current threats like Log4Shell exploitation over insecure channels.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in 'Secure Communication Channel Setup' (Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Asset Security > Asset Provisioning > Security Controls and Hardening > Cryptographic Controls Provisioning > Secure Communication Channel Setup). Generate 50-75 high-quality flashcards using the exact schema provided below. Ensure coverage of all learning objectives (spanning Bloom's: Remember/Understand/Apply/Analyze/Evaluate/Create), active learning activities (e.g., discussion on PFS trade-offs, peer teaching TLS handshakes, OpenSSL labs), and 4-layer scaffolding (Foundation: basics/prereqs; Components: handshakes/ciphers; Implementation: configs/testing; Integration: advanced/zero-trust). Incorporate research context: TLS/DTLS for confidentiality/integrity/auth; cipher suites (mandate AEAD like AES-GCM, ECDHE-PFS per RFC 9325; disable CBC/RC4); PFS/FS; misconceptions (HTTPS != secure sans PFS). **Flashcard Schema (Strictly Follow):** - **Basic Q&A (40%):** Front: Question. Back: Answer | Explanation (link to objective/layer/activity) | Reference. - **MCQ (30%):** Front: Question + A/B/C/D options (1 correct). Back: Correct | Why correct | Why distractors wrong (use distractor protocol). Distractors: misconceptions/outdated/partial truths. - **Cloze (30%):** Front: Text with {{c1::answer}} blanks. Back: Completed | Layer/Objective link. Balance: 20% Layer1, 25% Layer2, 25% Layer3, 30% Layer4; proportional Bloom's. Output as JSON array: [{'type': 'MCQ', 'front': '...', 'back': '...'}, ...]. Make engaging, precise, educational.
